Fig. 8 Disjoint Cycles Altered through Alternating Sequences of Three Moves
A closer inspection reveals that the metric of MT(k) includes an additional component - the number of moves required to reintroduce deleted edges. Since these supplementary moves can be generated by k′-opt moves where k′ < k, our focus shifts towards computing PMT (k), specifically the count of pure k-opt moves where removed and added edges are mutually exclusive.

The derivation of an explicit formula for PMT(k) can be linked to series A061714 in The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences [33]:

PMT (k) = (−1)^k ∑[i=0 to k-1] [(−1)^(k-1+i) * (k choose i + 1) / i!] for k ≥ 2.

Notably, the set of pure moves encompasses both sequential and non-sequential maneuvers. To assess the extent to which the search space has been expanded by incorporating non-sequential moves, we will calculate SPMT(k), the number of sequential, pure k-opt moves, and compare this count with PMT(k). An explicit formula for SPMT(k) can be obtained from a previously established result due to Hanlon, Stanley, and Stembridge [12].
